In addition to converting toolpath data into the correct format, post processors can also perform a variety of other functions, such as adding tool length compensation, calculating feed rates, and generating toolpath verification reports.

Overall, post processors are an essential part of the CAD/CAM workflow, and they play a critical role in enabling manufacturers to produce high-quality parts efficiently and accurately.
